qas.question: What is poor about inland areas such as Sichuan?
Who was the Vice Minister of Health?
What did Gao Qiang tell reporters in Beijing?

answers.text: public health care system in China is insufficient

qas.question: How economically forward has this area been?
Where is health care poor in China?
What did the Vice Minster of Health call the public health system in China?
What should the government of China be responsible for providing to earthquake survivors?

context: Experts point out that the earthquake hit an area that has been largely <a3_0>neglected and untouched<a3_0/> by China's economic rise. <a0_0>Health care<a0_0/> is poor in <a4_0>inland areas<a4_0/> such as Sichuan, highlighting the widening gap between prosperous urban dwellers and struggling rural people. Vice Minister of Health <a1_0>Gao Qiang<a1_0/> told reporters in Beijing that the "<a2_0>public health care system in China is <a5_0>insufficient<a5_0/><a2_0/>." The Vice Minister of Health also suggested that the government would pick up the costs of care to earthquake victims, many of whom have little or no insurance: "The government should be responsible for providing <a6_0>medical treatment<a6_0/> to them," he said.
